news_header: Six more bodies recovered from a South African mine as rescue efforts continue for illegal miners trapped underground.
news_text: Rescue operations are ongoing in a South African mine where six more bodies have been recovered, bringing the total to 15. Eight miners were rescued alive, while many others are believed to still be trapped 2km underground. The situation has escalated since police crackdowns on illegal mining began last year, with reports of over 100 miners dying underground. Disturbing videos have surfaced showing the dire conditions, with miners pleading for help due to hunger and lack of supplies. The authorities have faced criticism for their handling of the situation.
